# Average Agent

![domain:utility](https://img.shields.io/badge/utility-3D8BD3?style=flat&logo=data%3Aimage%2Fsvg%2Bxml%3Bbase64%%2BCjwvc3ZnPgo%3D)
[![link to source code](https://img.shields.io/badge/Source%20Code-E8ECF1?style=flat&logo=data%3Aimage%2Fsvg%2Bxml%3Bbase64%%2BCjwvc3ZnPgo%3D)](https://github.com/fetchai/uAgent-Examples/tree/main/1-uagents/utility/average-agent)
[![live](https://img.shields.io/badge/Live-8A2BE2?logo=elixir
)](https://agentverse.ai/agents/details/agent1qvtnt9s6uhua3c3jundxrpgqjsy9quc2h4s83anjg6r2m95g90dn2ruw8zm/profile)

This agent accepts a list type object (e.g. tuple, list, set) of integer and/or float values, and calculates different mathematical averages and deviations from them.

## Example input

```python
Prompt(
    data=(-3, 5, 8, -2, 4, 6, 8, 3, 5, 12)
)
```

## Example output

```python
Response(
    mean=4.6,
    median=5.0,
    median_low=5.0,
    median_high=5.0,
    mode=5.0,
    multi_mode=[5, 8],
    population_variance=18.44,
    sample_variance=20.488888888888887,
    population_standard_deviation=4.294182110716778,
    sample_standard_deviation=4.526465385804788,
)
```

## Usage Example

Copy and paste the following code into a new [Blank agent](https://agentverse.ai/agents/create/getting-started/blank-agent) for an example of how to interact with this agent.


```python
from uagents import Agent, Context, Model


class Prompt(Model):
    data: tuple[int | float, ...] | list[int | float] | set[int | float]


class Response(Model):
    mean: float
    median: float
    median_low: float
    median_high: float
    mode: float
    multi_mode: list[int | float]
    population_variance: float
    sample_variance: float
    population_standard_deviation: float
    sample_standard_deviation: float


agent = Agent()


AVERAGE_AGENT_ADDRESS = "<deployed_agent_address>"

prompts = [
    (1, 6, 3, 7, 2, 5, 8, 3, 5, 12),  # tuple
    [-3, 5, 8, -2, 4, 6, 8, 3, 5, 12],  # list
    set([1.5, 6.3, 3.7, -7.2, 2.9, 5.8, 8.3, -5.5, 12.1]),  # set
]


@agent.on_event("startup")
async def handle_startup(ctx: Context):
    ctx.storage.clear()


@agent.on_event("startup")
async def send_message(ctx: Context):
    m = ctx.storage.get("matrix") or {}
    for prompt in prompts:
        await ctx.send(AVERAGE_AGENT_ADDRESS, Prompt(data=prompt))
        ctx.logger.info(f"Sent prompt to AI agent: {prompt}")
        m[str(ctx.session)] = {"prompt": list(prompt)}
    ctx.storage.set("matrix", m)


@agent.on_message(Response)
async def handle_response(ctx: Context, sender: str, msg: Response):
    m = ctx.storage.get("matrix") or {}
    ctx.logger.info(f"Received response from: {sender}")
    if str(ctx.session) not in m:  # this should never happen
        ctx.logger.error("Session not found in storage.")
        return
    m[str(ctx.session)]["response"] = msg.model_dump()
    ctx.storage.set("matrix", m)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    agent.run()
```

### Local Agent 

1. Install the necessary packages:
   ```bash
   pip install uagents
   ```

2. To interact with this agent from a local agent instead, replace `agent = Agent()` in the above with:
   ```python
   agent = Agent(
       name="user",
       endpoint="http://localhost:8000/submit",
   )
   ```

3. Run the agent:
   ```bash
   python agent.py
   ```
